2. “Driving within the range” of your headlights means:
column4: Driving at a speed that allows you to stop within the distance covered by your headlights.
column6: Always obeying the posted speed limit at night.
column8: Using your headlights on narrow roads with many curves.
column10: Using your headlights at night, as required by the law.

column2: 10. The driver of a school bus containing pupils:
column4: must make a left turn at a steady red light when turning from a one-way road into another one-way road.

column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.

column4: you are required by law to give written consent to take the test.
column6: when you drive in New York State, you have agreed to take a chemical test if requested by an officer.
